title: Intern
description: Able to understand basic programming syntax, simple data types, variables, and basic control structures such as if-else and loops. Limited or no real-world coding experience.
instruction: Focus on verifying basic logical thinking, programming mindset, and willingness to learn. Suitable for candidates undergoing internship programs.

title: Fresher
description: Has basic knowledge of software development concepts, simple algorithms, and can complete basic coding exercises. Familiar with at least one programming language.
instruction: Assess candidate's ability to apply theoretical knowledge to simple tasks and their potential to grow with guidance.

title: Junior Developer
description: Capable of building small features or modules with supervision. Understands debugging, code versioning, basic testing, and can follow coding standards. Limited exposure to production environments.
instruction: Test for ability to work independently on well-defined tasks, and basic understanding of software development processes.

title: Middle Developer
description: Can independently design, develop, and maintain mid-sized features or services. Understands system architecture, database design basics, optimization, and common design patterns.
instruction: Evaluate candidateâ€™s ability to solve moderate complexity problems, collaborate in teams, and apply best practices consistently.

title: Senior Developer
description: Has deep knowledge of system scalability, performance, security, and maintainability. Can lead technical discussions, mentor juniors, and deliver high-quality production-level code.
instruction: Focus on technical leadership, problem-solving in complex environments, and ability to guide and review team members' work.

title: Expert Developer
description: Mastery in software architecture, system design, and scaling high-traffic systems. Can design complex solutions across multiple domains and technologies, and influence technical direction at an organizational level.
instruction: Challenge candidate's architectural thinking, innovation capability, and ability to solve extremely complex problems with strategic solutions.
